result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Sockness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the premises of the Wautoma Express Convenience Store, M. Kratz and/or M. Kasch.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons which would include any device that as possessed is being used or threatened to be used to inflict injury to another.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Pursuant to s. 968.20 the weapon seized during this incident (16.25 BUD hunting knife - 10.5 fixed blade) is ordered forfeited and destroyed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Sockness

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:13 AM: Defendant Daniel J. Sockness in court with attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairments on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/Enh:   NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - 8 mos WCJ - I/S (Huber and GT if revoked) 4 days TS credit - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  No contact whatsoever with Wautoma Express Convenience Store; M. Kratz and/or M. Kasch; Not to possess any dangerous weapon - any device that as possessed is being used or threatened to be used to inflict injury to another; Court Costs plus DNA sample and surcharge. Expungement process of DNA record thru DOJ explained to Def. Pursuant to s. 968.20 - weapon seized during this incident to be forfeited and destroyed.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sanders-Brown requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:25 pm.
Per the Court - No response required to the DE's letter
from the DE to the Court
Not to be in the possession of any dangerous weapons, including firearms, including any device capable of causing harm to another.

Case Called @ 1:03 PM: Defendant Daniel J. Sockness in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  SPD takes no position on bond request.   NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:05 pm.
